Study Title: Brentuximab Vedotin Associated With Chemotherapy in Untreated Patients With Hodgkin Lymphoma.
Brief Summary: This study aims to evaluate the efficacy of brentuximab vedotin + AVD combination (doxorubicine, vinblastine, dacarbazine) in patients with Hodgkin lymphoma stage I / II with an unfavorable diagnosis, assessed by the negativity of PET (positron emission tomography ) after two cycles of chemotherapy.
Interventions: DRUG: Doxorubicin|DRUG: Bleomycin|DRUG: Vinblastine|DRUG: Dacarbazine|DRUG: Brentuximab Vedotin
Primary Outcome Measures: PET2 assessment, Assessment of PET after two cycles according to the five-point scale Deauville criteria (Negative = 1, 2, 3 and Positive = 4, 5), based on central review., 8 weeks
Secondary Outcome Measures: Complete response (CR) rate, according to Cheson 2007 criteria, 16 weeks|Progression free survival (PFS), Survival without disease progression, 5 years|Overall survival (OS), 5 years
Study Design: Allocation: RANDOMIZED|Intervention Model: PARALLEL|Masking: NONE|Primary Purpose: TREATMENT
Locations: ZNA Middelheim, Antwerpen, Belgium|ZNA Stuivenberg, Antwerpen, Belgium|A.Z.
